intro: Johnsonia pubescens var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy Johnsonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
